articleContent.title: Arpeggio: 11th in A# (Shape: A)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: 11th in A# (Shape: A)

## Brief Presentation
An arpeggio is a musical technique where notes from a chord are played in a sequence rather than simultaneously. The 11th arpeggio in A# involves the notes A#, C#, E#, G#, and D#.

## Notes and Intervals
- A# (Root)
- C# (Major 3rd)
- E# (Perfect 5th)
- G# (Major 7th)
- D# (Perfect 11th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
This arpeggio, with its major 7th and perfect 11th intervals, has a jazzy and sophisticated quality. It is often used in jazz, fusion, and neo-soul genres to add color and interest to chord progressions. The major 7th and perfect 11th intervals create a rich and modern sound that can evoke feelings of elegance and complexity.

## Songs
1. **"Cantaloupe Island" by Herbie Hancock**: This jazz classic features arpeggios and chord voicings that highlight the sophisticated sound of the 11th arpeggio.
   
2. **"Spain" by Chick Corea**: In this jazz fusion piece, the 11th arpeggio is used extensively to create harmonic interest and add a modern twist to the composition.

3. **"Lingus" by Snarky Puppy**: This neo-soul/jazz fusion track incorporates the 11th arpeggio in its complex chord progressions, showcasing its versatility and emotive quality.
